intro: Niphobolus piloselloides, commonly known as the sticky monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often covered in fine, sticky hairs. The species is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy and ecologically important flowering plants.
